identificationModule.briefTitle: The Mitopure Challenge to Detect Levels of Urolithin A in Dried Blood Spots
identificationModule.officialTitle: Open-labelled Study to Validate Home-based Use of a Health and Wellness Kit (The Mitopure Challenge) to Detect Levels of Urolithin A in Dried Blood Spots After Intake of Mitopure (Proprietary Urolithin A)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Open labelled, virtual home based study to assess the test repeatability and the failure/rejection rate of the samples collected at home by participants.

armGroups.label: Mitopure Challenge to assess blood levels of Urolithin A after dietary and Mitopure intake
armGroups.description: Mitopure challenge with diet (Pomegranate juice- Before) followed by Mitopure supplementation (After) to compare levels in blood spots of UA-Glucuronide (in ng/mL)

interventions.name: Mitopure
interventions.description: Fruit flavored sachet containing fixed dose of Mitopure™ (Proprietary Urolithin A)
armGroupLabels: Mitopure Challenge to assess blood levels of Urolithin A after dietary and Mitopure intake

interventions.name: Pomegranate Juice
armGroupLabels: Mitopure Challenge to assess blood levels of Urolithin A after dietary and Mitopure intake

primaryOutcomes.measure: Failure/rejection rate (% of the samples) collected at home by participants.
primaryOutcomes.description: Acceptability target goal is to hit 80% of analyzed samples

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sensitivity and specificity (% of the samples) of the analytical method developed to test Urolithin A in dry blood spots.
Fold change increase in the levels of UA-Glucuronide (in ng/mL) in the dried blood spots provided in the kit before and after the challenge
Validation of a health questionnaire on participants health status

references.citation: Singh A, D'Amico D, Andreux PA, Dunngalvin G, Kern T, Blanco-Bose W, Auwerx J, Aebischer P, Rinsch C. Direct supplementation with Urolithin A overcomes limitations of dietary exposure and gut microbiome variability in healthy adults to achieve consistent levels across the population. Eur J Clin Nutr. 2022 Feb;76(2):297-308. doi: 10.1038/s41430-021-00950-1. Epub 2021 Jun 11.
